abstract: A report says that the last two studios to back Toshiba’s HD DVD format — NBC Universal and Paramount — are backing away from their exclusive commitment in the wake of Warner Brothers’ endorsement of the rival Blu-ray format. Still unclear is whether anyone needs high definition discs at all.
snippet: A report says that the last two studios to back Toshiba’s HD DVD format — NBC Universal and Paramount — are backing away from their exclusive commitment in the wake of Warner Brothers’ endorsement of the rival Blu-ray format. Still unclear is whet...
lead_paragraph: Nothing has been announced, but Variety is reporting that the last two major studios backing HD DVD — NBC Universal and Paramount — are opening the door for a switch to Blu-ray. These studios have commitments to release some discs this year in HD DVD, but both have ended their exclusive commitment to that format, which is backed by a group led by Toshiba.
